page.title: 01East & West Saltoun,
page.content: East Lothian This is primarily a farming area, the rich agricultural land gives rise to large farms growing cereal crops, mainly barley. Field boundaries are denoted by hedges or trees, resulting in a gently rolling landscape with few signs of habitation. This is a distinctly rural area, with scattered farm steadings, hamlets and the occasional small village containing a general store and sub post office. The main village in this block is East Saltoun characterised with its typical single storey cottages built in traditional stone. The village also contains an historic church with spire. Most of the villagers work either on the surrounding farmland, much of it owned by a single landowner or commute through to Edinburgh and other major towns in East Lothian
